text: Quite dramatic. Since you're offering I'd look for things that might have changed suddenly that could impact your signal(s). Latency, timing, server upgrade, software upgrade - faster/slower performance, cross matching are a few. Left field thought is that whoever you were feeding from pre-off went wholly inplay 6 months ago and affected you on both counts.

elements.text: Quite dramatic. Since you're offering I'd look for things that might have changed suddenly that could impact your signal(s). Latency, timing, server upgrade, software upgrade - faster/slower performance, cross matching are a few. Left field thought is that whoever you were feeding from pre-off went wholly inplay 6 months ago and affected you on both counts.

text: I rechoose my parameters every month. And then my backrest results use those chosen values for the next month. This way I reduce the chance that my backtests are the result of cherry picking

text:
Is that backtest chart in-sample or out-of-sample? Correlation between the two? 

There must be dozens of people starting, stopping and changing things every day. Not surprising things change and evolve. Like <@UN1497LJC>  I have the occasional tune-up and I seem to need one more often lately, monthly not every 4-6 month. That 12month test chart assumes the same params will just keep working when in reality you'd have tweaked it.

elements.text:

text:
<@UEA14GBRR> If I have an edge then it tends to last years only slightly degrading in that time. I’d want at least 12 months of backtests to be a smooth straight line with no tweaks.
If it needed tweaking every month I imagine it’s because the edge is tiny in which case I’d focus on improving that.

text: You're right about the small edge <@UUCD6P13J>, but I didn't change my stuff for 2.5 years when I launched it, then a year, then 6 months etc.  And you're obv right about the ideal 12month backtest, Andy seems to be onto something so I'm just speculating about what he'd have done in reality if those results were live rather than test.

text:
If it helps, I've done pre-race for about 8-months since starting using flumine. I use ML models and have found that they last for about 2 months before degrading.

I will soon find out if this is seasonality, or just that the world keeps changing!

text: Edges can erode. It also depends on whether you've modelled your edge correctly - your approach may just be one that's not robust to time, and therefore needs some recalibration every so often (whereas if you understand it better, your model may be more time invariant)

elements.text: Edges can erode. It also depends on whether you've modelled your edge correctly - your approach may just be one that's not robust to time, and therefore needs some recalibration every so often (whereas if you understand it better, your model may be more time invariant)

text: fwiw i noticed a distinct change in PNL on GB racing around June as well (see the change in gradient). I strongly believe it's either a) some fundamental change as to which races are scheduled making them less profitable  (I don't follow racing enough to know what) , or b) some participant change (e.g. some corporate could have been hedging their flow on betfair, but no longer doing so)

elements.text: fwiw i noticed a distinct change in PNL on GB racing around June as well (see the change in gradient). I strongly believe it's either a) some fundamental change as to which races are scheduled making them less profitable  (I don't follow racing enough to know what) , or b) some participant change (e.g. some corporate could have been hedging their flow on betfair, but no longer doing so)

text: But you can try and answer some of these questions, has your roi dropped? EV? Is it match rate? Less opportunities? Simulate with full match etc.

elements.text: But you can try and answer some of these questions, has your roi dropped? EV? Is it match rate? Less opportunities? Simulate with full match etc.

text: I am just trying to provide some evidence that, contrary to everyone telling <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> that he has no edge, that he may in fact have an edge but a) it doesn't stand the test of time because it just isn't modelled well enough and his features may just need to be more time-invariant, or b) simply he was relying on external behaviour which is no longer present. I noticed a step change in behaviour around June too, so I suspect a change in external factors :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I think the markets are just more competitive. This chart shows my live returns over the last couple of years. While it was smooth in 2023, there are definitely has more kinks in 2024 which I've had to iron out with more frequent tune ups. I'm dreading the day I have to worry about my day job.:disappointed:
